reviewText: My toddler granddaughter loves this Barney video just like she does all the other Barney videos, but I even enjoy this one. If I were a little kid, this is the one that I would watch over and over....in fact, I have...but with my granddaughter, of course.  The make-believe part where the kids and Barney journey by ship to Imagination Island is perfect!  It reminds me of the old Storybook Land that used to sit where DFW airport is now. This is a very charming video that kids up to the age of 10 are sure to enjoy.

reviewText: We bought this for our son who loves this video.  Now my husband and I find ourselves singing the songs even when we are by ourselves!!!!!!!!This is great learning for kids and much music that will even draw you into it!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just bought this on sale at Walmart on VHS for about $6, and the box said it was 29 minutes, but it ended up to be the full-length 50 minute show.  It's not the same studio background as the TV show, so it has that movie feel, and it's PERFECT for my 3 1/2 year old daughter (and my 1 1/2 year old son even sits still to watch it!).  And, though I normally don't enjoy Barney shows, I must admit I find this little movie so sweet!  It starts off in a cozy girly bedroom with two friends for a sleepover, then Barney shows up and they venture off onto a pirate ship to meet the guys and other dinosaur characters.  They land on an island, meet this great character played by a middle aged man who ends up sharing his toy inventions after the gang teaches him how great sharing can be.  The man sings a great catchy song and is very entertaining.  Then the gang travels home and the girls end up back in the cozy bedroom.  Catchy songs are just minutes in between the whole video.  This is great for girls and boys, such a sweet fun feel to the whole show.  I have become a fan of Barney since my kids love him, and the shows teach such great examples, and I have to say of all we have, this is the best show!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I saw this video over Christmas at my mother-in-law's house, and am buying it now. It's very good, by Barney standards, and even has special effects! The kids imagine they're on a pirate ship, and sing a lot of seafaring  songs. Then, they reach the island, where they meet an eccentric toymaker  who makes toys just for himself. The kids teach him that it can be fun to  share your toys. It's pretty cute and enjoyable; not as irritating to  adults as most Barney fare.
Title: N/A

reviewText: As the parent of two small children, I have seen everything that Barney has to offer.  Hands down, this is Barney's best.  The story is enchanting and the child actors are believable.  The music is a great collection of sea songs.  The video's best feature is the introduction of the character Professor Erasmus Q. Tinkerputt.  What a gem!  Keep it up Barney!
Title: N/A
